result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Patrick Sorenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Patrick Sorenson

defendant.name: Sorenson, Thomas Patrick

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 12:00Defendant Thomas Patrick Sorenson in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  William Thorie  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thorie  - Amend to State DC  fine and sentence for jail time served.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to the amended charge Otherwise Disorderly Conduct.     Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS    The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty  of the amended charge otherwise disorderly conduct. Court sentences the defendant to Time Served.

Bond conditions read to the Defendant by the Court Commissioner.
Address: correct
DOB: correct
Phone: 651-703-3794

4:03 Defendant Thomas Patrick Sorenson in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appears via phone.   Defendant has copy of complaint. Courts reads charges and maximum penalties.   Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas not guilty. Court rec's and enters. THorie: $2000 signature bond with no contact. Nelson has objection. Def qualfies for the PD and has not been in the armed services.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
